canonical_structure.name: UBX-AID-ALM
canonical_structure.description: GPS aiding almanac input/output message. This message can be used to send almanac data to the receiver or to poll for it. The message length can be either 8 bytes (containing 'svid' and 'week' only) or 40 bytes (including the 'dwrd' block).

fields.name: svid
fields.description: SV ID for which this Almanac Data is (Valid Range: 1 .. 32 or 51, 56, 63).

fields.name: week
fields.description: Issue Date of Almanac (GPS week number). If this value is 0, the 'dwrd' block (Almanac Words) is typically not sent by the receiver, resulting in an 8-byte message.

fields.name: dwrd
fields.description: Almanac Words. Optional block dependent on 'week' field and message length.

adjudication.reasoning: The extraction accurately captures the structure of the UBX-AID-ALM message for the u-blox 8 generation. It correctly identifies the Class (0x0B) and Message ID (0x30) and provides a clear description of the variable-length nature of the payload (8 vs 40 bytes). The field definitions for 'svid', 'week', and the 'dwrd' array are consistent with official documentation.
